article.title: Matter-antimatter coexistence method for finite density QCD toward a solution of the sign problem

choices: Two separate QCD systems with opposite chemical potentials in four-dimensional Euclidean space-time.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the correlation term Sx introduced in formula (7)?
choices: To represent the interaction between quarks and gluons within each system.
To control the strength of the interaction between the matter and antimatter systems.

To ensure the total fermionic determinant remains real in all cases.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is significant about the expression in Formula (14)?
choices: It demonstrates that the fermionic determinant becomes purely imaginary for large values of λ.
It proves that the proposed method is equivalent to simulating QCD with an isospin chemical potential.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the advantage of using the more sophisticated correlation  Sξ  in formula (15) compared to the simpler  Sx in formula (7)?
choices: Sξ  completely eliminates the need for extrapolation to λ = 0.
Sξ  is computationally less expensive than Sx.
